# Treasury â€“ Domain Overview

## Scope
The Treasury domain governs liquidity management, cash positioning,
funding operations, and financial risk related to cash and equivalents.

This domain ensures that the institution can meet its financial
obligations at all times.

## Characteristics
- Institution-wide visibility
- Strong consistency and reconciliation requirements
- High sensitivity to timing and accuracy
- Tight coupling with risk and regulatory oversight

## Domain Authority
This domain is authoritative for:
- Liquidity positions
- Cash balances at institutional level
- Funding and investment positioning

Other domains may supply transactional data but must not redefine
treasury positions.
